function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increased energy consumption due to people spending more time at home.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Change in daily routine leading to increased use of kitchen appliances during peak time of energy consumption.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Change in work and school schedules affecting variance and rate of change in non-hvac load profiles.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large fluctuations in energy usage observed during pandemic-impacted months.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Significant increase in total daily non-hvac loads during pandemic-impacted months.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Remote learning in public schools","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in energy use behavior","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in household energy use due to prolonged time spent at home during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surge in covid-19 cases coinciding with an increase in non-hvac energy use during a specific period.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-weather normalized loads analysis increases the risk of incomplete understanding of load behavior across a day-long period, potentially leading to inaccurate conclusions.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparison of energy consumption across income levels may reveal disparities in access to resources and energy usage patterns, with potential implications for public health and well-being.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Study of hvac and non-hvac loads across pandemic and pre-pandemic periods may provide insights into the impact of public health crises on indoor environmental quality and disease transmission in built environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on outdoor weather conditions for hvac loads","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate load characterization of non-hvac loads","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited sample sizes for household income data analysis","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential outliers in household income data","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete data in housing unit records","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close proximity and high density of occupants in housing units may lead to increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of temperature data to analyze hvac use may reveal patterns of occupant behavior and routines.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Regular data collection and monitoring of electricity use in housing units may lead to increased human contact in the built environment, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Submetering of building energy usage requires physical installation of ct coils on each circuit, potentially increasing the exposure of maintenance staff and installers to contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited monitoring of certain circuits due to the constraints of the home energy monitoring system may result in incomplete data collection, affecting the accuracy of energy use analysis.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gathering data from multiple housing units in different states increases the risk of cross-contamination of infectious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparison of pre-pandemic and post-pandemic electricity use may overlook the potential impact of contagious diseases on energy consumption patterns.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Drawing conclusions about changes in energy use behavior without considering the influence of contagious diseases may lead to incomplete findings.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic introducing unprecedented changes in residential building energy consumption.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption due to changes in occupant behavior and usage of residential buildings during the pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited information quantifying consumption variations by sector","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of electricity in the residential sector shifts additional energy costs to households","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased time spent at home during the pandemic may have led to differences in temperature tolerances and influenced hvac use, impacting energy consumption and potentially increasing the risk of indoor air quality issues.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative data reported on the impacts of covid-19 on energy use of lighting and hvac loads in individual buildings, leading to uncertainty and potential inefficiencies in energy management strategies.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited quantification of changes in electricity use for typical housing units during the pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of changes in heating and cooling hvac energy use in residential buildings during the pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in streaming services, social media use, remote work applications, and gaming","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use cooking","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in energy consumption patterns due to lifestyle adjustments during the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher and more variable population during the pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 due to stay-at-home
